intro: Rhodiola algida var. tangutica, commonly known as the Tangut rosebay, is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau and adjacent areas. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to harsh mountainous conditions. Rhodiola algida var. tangutica is also valued for its potential medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
